Statement.paragraph: The Watershed and Flood Prevention Operations (WFPO) Program provides technical and financial assistance to states, local governments and Tribes (project sponsors) to plan and implement authorized watershed project plans for the purpose of: <bullet> watershed protection. <bullet> flood mitigation. <bullet> water quality improvements. <bullet> soil erosion reduction. <bullet> rural, municipal and industrial water supply. <bullet> irrigation. <bullet> water management. <bullet> sediment control. <bullet> fish and wildlife enhancement. <bullet> hydropower.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: In order to be approved, projects must (1) be publicly sponsored, (2) be 250,000 acres or less, and (3) have at least 20 percent of benefits related to agriculture, including rural communities. In addition and in accordance with statute, projects that will exceed $5 million in Federal contributions or with single structures holding more than 2,500 acre-feet require Congressional approval.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Sponsor capacity is an essential project element; sponsors must demonstrate capacity to implement, operate, and maintain the project, including possessing the necessary authorities; funding; acquisition of easements or other rights needed; and demonstrated capability to operate and maintain the project upon completion.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Pursuant to Congressional guidance, the agency process for prioritizing watershed projects must consider (1) the agency's mission, (2) existing investment in watershed projects, and (3) future needs for improving watershed condition and mitigating the potential for watershed impairments. Agency Mission

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: NRCS' Mission Statement is ``Helping People Help the Land,'' which highlights the agency's role in developing and delivering high quality products and services that enable people to be good stewards of the nation's soil, water, and related natural resources on non-Federal lands. The vision is a landscape where working farms, forests, and ranches are in balance with a healthy environment. This mission statement aligns seamlessly with the purposes of the watershed program and the agency's emphasis on assisting agricultural producers and communities address the dual challenges of adapting to and mitigating the effects of climate change. Existing Investment

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: To guide investment in existing watershed projects, NRCS will focus on those projects where remediation is required. These are projects where the engineering design or related aspects of implementation are not operating as intended, as evaluated and verified through inspection. An estimated 49 projects in eight states are in need of remediation at an estimated $55 million, or four percent of total needs for the period 2016-2020. Based on funding availability, NRCS will allocate an appropriate level to address remediation needs on an annual basis. Future Needs

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: To guide investment in future needs for improving watershed condition and mitigating potential for watershed impairments, NRCS is establishing a process based on state and national priorities. The process will include an annual announcement program funding (APF) that will outline the specific state and national priorities to be emphasized in the funding year. This allows the agency to focus funding effectively, while providing flexibility over time to accommodate emerging watershed protection priorities. NRCS will evaluate and rank potential projects for funding annually based on alignment with program priorities established at the state and national levels to be locally responsive, and nationally consistent: 1. Statement.paragraph: This annual process and the associated ranking factors will result in prioritizing projects that will address a locally important, pressing natural resource issue in a timely manner.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Sponsors would be expected to respond to the APF for any project proposed for funding, including those needs outlined in this report and detailed in Appendix A. This proactive process ensures that funding will be directed to those projects best positioned for immediate implementation. Summary

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Many challenges that face our nation's food security, water quality, water supplies, wildlife habitat, rural economies, and communities are most cost-effectively and efficiently addressed at a watershed scale. The USDA-NRCS watershed program is authorized to address these and related challenges. Historic droughts, floods, and other extreme weather events in recent years have demonstrated the value of previous investments in this program--nearly $2.2 billion in benefits each year accrue as a result of these investments. Today, the watershed program offers the opportunity to address pressing water management issues facing agriculture and communities.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: In preparing this multi-year plan NRCS conducted an assessment of current needs. Through that process nearly $1.4 billion in estimated funding needs for 2016-2020 were identified. In addition, NRCS sought input from stakeholders on priorities for the program, going forward. Recommendations were used to help shape a priority setting process that accommodates local needs and national priorities. NRCS will use the prioritization process outlined in this plan to focus funding on the highest priority projects for improving watershed condition and building landscape resilience and preserving, protecting, and improving the nation's land and water resources and quality of the environment. paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Sec. 1001. Declaration of policy.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Erosion, floodwater, and sediment damages in the watersheds of the rivers and streams of the United States, causing loss of life and damage to property, constitute a menace to the national welfare; and it is the sense of Congress that the Federal Government should cooperate with states and their political subdivisions, soil or water conservation districts, flood prevention or control districts, and other local public agencies for the purpose of preventing such damages, of furthering the conservation, development, utilization, and disposal of water, and the conservation and utilization of land and thereby of preserving, protecting, and improving the nation's land and water resources and the quality of the environment.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Sec. 1002. Definitions.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: For the purposes of this chapter, the following terms shall mean:

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: The ''Secretary''--the Secretary of Agriculture of the United

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: States.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: ``Works of improvement''--any undertaking for--

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (1) flood prevention (including structural and land

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: treatment measures),

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (2) the conservation, development, utilization, and

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: disposal of water, or

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (3) the conservation and proper utilization of land,

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: in watershed or sub-watershed area not exceeding two

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: hundred and fifty thousand acres and not including any

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: single structure which provides more than twelve

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: thousand five hundred acre-feet of floodwater detention

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: of total capacity. No appropriation shall be made for

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: construction costs in excess of $5,000,000, or which

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: includes any structure which provides more than twenty-

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: five hundred acre-feet of total capacity unless such

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: plan has been approved by resolutions adopted by the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: appropriate Committees of the Senate and House of

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Forestry of the Senate and the Committee on Agriculture

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: of the House of Representatives and in the case of any

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: plan involving any single structure of more than 4,000

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: acre-feet of total capacity the appropriate Committees

Statement.paragraph: respectively. Each project must contain benefits

Statement.paragraph: directly related to agriculture, including rural

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: communities that account for at least 20 percent of the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: thereof, soil or water conservation district, flood prevention

Statement.paragraph: or control district, or combinations thereof, or any other

Statement.paragraph: Sec. 1003. Assistance to local organizations.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: In order to assist local organizations in preparing and carrying out plans for works of improvement, the Secretary is authorized, upon application of local organizations if such application has been submitted to, and not disapproved within 45 days by, the state agency having supervisory responsibility over programs provided for in this chapter, or by the Governor if there is no state agency having such responsibility--

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (1) to conduct such investigations and surveys as may be

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: necessary to prepare plans for works of improvement;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (2) to prepare plans and estimates required for adequate

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: engineering evaluation;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (3) to make allocations of costs to the various purposes to

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: show the basis of such allocations and to determine whether

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: benefits exceed costs;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (4) to cooperate and enter into agreements with and to

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: furnish financial and other assistance to local organizations:

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Provided, That, for the land-treatment measures, the Federal

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: assistance shall not exceed the rate of assistance for similar

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: practices under existing national programs;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (5) to obtain the cooperation and assistance of other Federal

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: agencies in carrying out the purposes of this section;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (6) to enter into agreements with landowners, operators, and

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: occupiers, individually or collectively, based on conservation

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: plans of such landowners, operators, and occupiers which are

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: developed in cooperation with and approved by the soil and

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: water conservation district in which the land described in the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: agreement is situated, to be carried out on such land during a

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Sec. 1003a. Cost-share assistance.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (a) Easements.--The Secretary may provide cost-share assistance to project sponsors to enable such sponsors to acquire perpetual wetland or floodplain conservation easements to perpetuate, restore and enhance the natural capability of wetlands and floodplains to retain excessive floodwaters, improve water quality and quantity, and provide habitat for fish and wildlife.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (b) Amount.--The Secretary shall require that project sponsors of watershed projects provide up to 50 percent of the cost of acquiring easements under subsection (a) of this section.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Sec. 1005. Works of improvement.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (1) Engineering and Other Services; Reimbursement; Advances.--At such time as the Secretary and the interested local organization have agreed on a plan for works of improvement, and the Secretary has determined that the benefits exceed the costs, and the local organization has met the requirements for participation in carrying out the works of improvement as set forth in section 1004 of this title, the local organization may secure engineering and other services, including the design, preparation of contracts and specifications, awarding of contracts, and supervision of construction, in connection with such works of improvement, by retaining or employing a professional engineer or engineers satisfactory to the Secretary or may request the Secretary to provide such services: Provided, That if the local organization elects to employ a professional engineer or engineers, the Secretary shall reimburse the local organization for the costs of such engineering and other services secured by the local organization as are properly chargeable to such works of improvement in an amount not to exceed the amount agreed upon in the plan for works of improvement or any modification thereof: Provided further, That the Secretary may advance such amounts as may be necessary to pay for such services, but such advances with respect to any works of improvement shall not exceed five per centum of the estimated installation cost of such works.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (2) Federal Construction; Request by Local Organization.--Except as to the installation of works of improvement on Federal lands, the Secretary shall not construct or enter into any contract for the construction of any structure: Provided, That, if requested to do so by the local organization, the Secretary may enter into contracts for the construction of structures.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (3) Transmission of Certain Plans to Congress.--Whenever the estimated Federal contribution to the construction costs of works of improvement in the plan for any watershed or sub-watershed area shall exceed $5,000,000 or the works of improvement include any structure having a total capacity in excess of twenty-five hundred acre-feet, the Secretary shall transmit a copy of the plan and the justification therefore to the Congress through the President.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (4) Transmission of Certain Plans and Recommendations to Congress.--Any plans for works of improvement involving an estimated Federal contribution to construction costs in excess of $5,000,000 or including any structure having a total capacity in excess of twenty- five hundred acre-feet

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (5) Rules and Regulations.--Prior to any Federal participation in the works of improvement under this chapter, the President shall issue such rules and regulations as he deems necessary or desirable to carry out the purposes of this chapter, and to assure the coordination of the work authorized under this chapter and related work of other agencies, including the Department of the Interior and the Department of the Army.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Sec. 1006 Cooperative Programs.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: The Secretary is authorized in cooperation with other Federal and with states and local agencies to make investigations and surveys of the watershed of rivers and other waterways as a basis for the development of coordinated programs. In areas where the programs of the Secretary of Agriculture may affect public or other lands under the jurisdiction of the Secretary of the Interior, the Secretary of the Interior is authorized to cooperate with the Secretary of Agriculture in the planning and development of works or programs for such lands.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: benefits of the works of improvement first become available,

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: with interest at a rate not to exceed the current market yield

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: for outstanding municipal obligations with remaining periods to

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: maturity comparable to the average maturity for the loan,

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: adjusted to the nearest \1/8\ of 1 percent. With respect to any

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: single plan for works of improvement, the amount of any such

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: loan or advancement shall not exceed $10,000,000.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Sec. 1006b Territorial application.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: The provisions of this chapter shall be applicable to Hawaii, Alaska, Puerto Rico, and the Virgin Islands.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Sec. 1007. Authorization of appropriations.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: There are hereby authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out the purposes of this chapter, such sums to remain available until expended. No appropriation hereafter available for assisting local organizations in preparing and carrying out plans for works of improvement under the provisions of section 1003 of this title or clause (a) of section 1006a of this title shall be available for any works of improvement pursuant to this chapter or otherwise in connection with the eleven watershed improvement programs authorized by section 13 of the Act of December 22, 1944 (58 Stat. 887), as amended and supplemented, or for making loans or advancements to state and local agencies as authorized by clause (b) of section 1006a of this title.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member
The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member
The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (1) The Secretary shall so notify the Secretary of the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Interior in order that the latter, as he desires, may make

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: surveys and investigations and prepare a report with

Statement.paragraph: recommendations concerning the conservation and development of

Statement.paragraph: Agriculture.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: contained in any such report of the Secretary of the Interior

Statement.paragraph: as he may submit to the Secretary of Agriculture prior to the

Statement.paragraph: time the local organization and the Secretary of Agriculture

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: have agreed on a plan for works of improvement. The plan shall

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Interior out of funds appropriated to his Department.

Statement.paragraph: Sec. 1009 Joint investigations and surveys by Secretary of the Army and Secretary of Agriculture; reports to Congress.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: The Secretary of the Army and the Secretary of Agriculture, when authorized to do so by resolutions adopted by the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate or the Committee on Public Works and Transportation of the House of Representatives, are authorized and directed to make joint investigations and surveys in accordance with their existing authorities of watershed areas in the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Virgin Islands, and to prepare joint reports on such investigations and surveys setting forth their recommendations for the installation of the works of improvement needed for flood prevention or the conservation, development, utilization, and disposal of water, and for flood control and allied purposes. Such joint reports shall be submitted to the Congress through the President for adoption and authorization by the Congress of the recommended works of improvement: Provided, That the project authorization procedure established by this chapter shall not be affected.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Sec. 1010 Data.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: The Secretary shall collect and maintain data on a national and state by state basis concerning--

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (1) expenditures for the individual flood control and

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: conservation measures for which assistance is provided under

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: this chapter; and

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (2) the expected flood control or environmental (including

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: soil erosion) benefits that will result from the implementation

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: of such measures.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Sec. 1011. Watershed restoration and enhancement agreements.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (a) In General.--For Fiscal Year 1997 and each fiscal year thereafter, appropriations made for the Bureau of Land Management may be used by the Secretary of the Interior for the purpose of entering into cooperative agreements with the heads of other Federal agencies, Tribal, state, and local governments, private and nonprofit entities, and landowners for the protection, restoration, and enhancement of fish and wildlife habitat and other resources on public or private land and the reduction of risk from natural disaster where public safety is threatened that benefit these resources on public lands within the watershed.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (b) Direct and Indirect Watershed Agreements.--The Secretary of the Interior may enter into a watershed restoration and enhancement agreement--

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (1) directly with a willing private landowner; or

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (2) indirectly through an agreement with a state, local, or

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Tribal government or other public entity, educational

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: institution, or private nonprofit organization.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (c) Terms and Conditions.--In order for the Secretary to enter into a watershed restoration and enhancement agreement--

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (1) the agreement shall--

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (A) include such terms and conditions mutually agreed

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: to by the Secretary and the landowner;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (B) improve the viability of and otherwise benefit

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: the fish, wildlife, and other biotic resources on

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: public land in the watershed;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (C) authorize the provision of technical assistance

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: by the Secretary in the planning of management

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: activities that will further the purposes of the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: agreement;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (D) provide for the sharing of costs of implementing

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: the agreement among the Federal Government, the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Landowner, and other entities, as mutually agreed on by

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: the affected interests; and

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (E) ensure that any expenditure by the Secretary

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: pursuant to the agreement is determined by the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Secretary to be in the public interest; and

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (2) the Secretary may require such other terms and conditions

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: as are necessary to protect the public investment on private

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: lands, provided such terms and conditions are mutually agreed

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: to by the Secretary and other landowners, state and local

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: governments or both.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Sec. 1012. Rehabilitation of structural measures near, at, or past their evaluated life expectancy.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (a) Definitions.--For purposes of this section:

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (1) Rehabilitation.--The term ''rehabilitation'', with

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: respect to a structural measure constructed as part of a

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: covered water resource project, means the completion of all

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: work necessary to extend the service life of the structural

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: measure and meet applicable safety and performance standards.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: This may include:

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (A) protecting the integrity of the structural

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: measure or prolonging the useful life of the structural

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: measure beyond the original evaluated life expectancy;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (B) correcting damage to the structural measure from

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: a catastrophic event;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (C) correcting the deterioration of structural

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: components that are deteriorating at an abnormal rate;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (D) upgrading the structural measure to meet changed

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: land use conditions in the watershed served by the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: structural measure or changed safety criteria

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: applicable to the structural measure; or

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (E) decommissioning the structure, if requested by

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: the local organization.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (2) Covered water resource project.--The term ''covered water

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: resource project'' means a work of improvement carried out

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: under any of the following:

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (A) This chapter

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (B) Section 13 of the Act of December 22, 1944

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (Public Law 78-534; 58 Stat. 905).

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (C) The pilot watershed program authorized under the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: heading ''Flood Prevention'' of the Department of

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Agriculture Appropriation Act, 1954 (Public Law 156; 67

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Stat. 214).

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (D) Subtitle H of title XV of the Agriculture and

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Food Act of 1981 (16 U.S.C. 3451 et seq.; commonly

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: known as the Resource Conservation and Development

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Program).

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (3) Structural measure.--The term ''structural measure''

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: means a physical improvement that impounds water, commonly

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: known as a dam, which was constructed as part of a covered

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: water resource project, including the impoundment area and

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: flood pool.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (b) Cost-Share Assistance for Rehabilitation.--

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (1) Assistance authorized.--The Secretary may provide

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: financial assistance to a local organization to cover a portion

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: of the total costs incurred for the rehabilitation of

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: structural measures originally constructed as part of a covered

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: water resource project. The total costs of rehabilitation

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: include the costs associated with all components of the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: rehabilitation project, including acquisition of land,

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: easements, and rights-of-ways, rehabilitation project

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: administration, the provision of technical assistance,

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: contracting, and construction costs, except that the local

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: organization shall be responsible for securing all land,

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: easements, or rights-of-ways necessary for the project.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (2) Amount of assistance; limitations.--The amount of Federal

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: funds that may be made available under this subsection to a

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: local organization for construction of a particular

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: rehabilitation project shall be equal to 65 percent of the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: total rehabilitation costs, but not to exceed 100 percent of

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: actual construction costs incurred in the rehabilitation.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: However, the local organization shall be responsible for the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: costs of water, mineral, and other resource rights and all

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: Federal, state, and local permits.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (3) Relation to land use and development regulations.--As a

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: condition on entering into an agreement to provide financial

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: assistance under this subsection, the Secretary, working in

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: concert with the affected unit or units of general purpose

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: local government, may require that proper zoning or other

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: developmental regulations are in place in the watershed in

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: which the structural measures to be rehabilitated under the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: agreement are located so that--

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (A) the completed rehabilitation project is not

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: quickly rendered inadequate by additional development;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: and

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (B) society can realize the full benefits of the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: rehabilitation investment.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (c) Technical Assistance for Watershed Project Rehabilitation.--The Secretary, acting through the Natural Resources Conservation Service, may provide technical assistance in planning, designing, and implementing rehabilitation projects should a local organization request such assistance. Such assistance may consist of specialists in such fields as engineering, geology, soils, agronomy, biology, hydraulics, hydrology, economics, water quality, and contract administration.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (d) Prohibited Use.--

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (1) Performance of operation and maintenance.--Rehabilitation

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: assistance provided under this section may not be used to

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: perform operation and maintenance activities specified in the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: agreement for the covered water resource project entered into

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: between the Secretary and the local organization responsible

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: for the works of improvement. Such operation and maintenance

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: activities shall remain the responsibility of the local

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: organization, as provided in the project work plan.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (2) Renegotiation.--Notwithstanding paragraph (1), as part of

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: the provision of financial assistance under subsection (b) of

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: this section, the Secretary may renegotiate the original

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: agreement for the covered water resource project entered into

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: between the Secretary and the local organization regarding

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: responsibility for the operation and maintenance of the project

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: when the rehabilitation is finished.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (e) Application for Rehabilitation Assistance.--A local organization may apply to the Secretary for technical and financial assistance under this section if the application has also been submitted to and approved by the state agency having supervisory responsibility over the covered water resource project at issue or, if there is no state agency having such responsibility, by the Governor of the state. The Secretary shall request the state dam safety officer (or equivalent state official) to be involved in the application process if state permits or approvals are required. The rehabilitation of structural measures shall meet standards established by the Secretary and address other dam safety issues. At the request of the local organization, personnel of the Natural Resources Conservation Service of the Department of Agriculture may assist in preparing applications for assistance.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (f) Ranking of Requests for Rehabilitation Assistance.--The Secretary shall establish such system of approving rehabilitation requests, recognizing that such requests will be received throughout the fiscal year and subject to the availability of funds to carry out this section, as is necessary for proper administration by the Department of Agriculture and equitable for all local organizations. The approval process shall be in writing, and made known to all local organizations and appropriate state agencies.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (g) Prohibition on Certain Rehabilitation Assistance.--The Secretary may not approve a rehabilitation request if the need for rehabilitation of the structure is the result of a lack of adequate maintenance by the party responsible for the maintenance.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (h) Authorization of Appropriations.--There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to provide financial and technical assistance under this section--

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (1) $5,000,000 for Fiscal Year 2001;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (2) $10,000,000 for Fiscal Year 2002;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (3) $15,000,000 for Fiscal Year 2003;

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (4) $25,000,000 for Fiscal Year 2004; and

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (5) $35,000,000 for Fiscal Year 2005.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (i) Assessment of Rehabilitation Needs.--The Secretary, in concert with the responsible state agencies, shall conduct an assessment of the rehabilitation needs of covered water resource projects in all states in which such projects are located.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (j) Recordkeeping and Reports.--

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (1) Secretary.--The Secretary shall maintain a data base to

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: track the benefits derived from rehabilitation projects

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: supported under this section and the expenditures made under

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: this section. On the basis of such data and the reports

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: submitted under paragraph (2), the Secretary shall prepare and

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: submit to Congress an annual report providing the status of

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: activities conducted under this section.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: (2) Grant recipients.--Not later than 90 days after the

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: completion of a specific rehabilitation project for which

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: assistance is provided under this section, the local

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: organization that received the assistance shall make a report

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: to the Secretary giving the status of any rehabilitation effort

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: undertaken using financial assistance provided under this

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. Thank you, Ranking Member

Statement.paragraph: section.
